Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2017 05:26PM Oscarmom355 wrote: I can only give you my own experience recently. I needed a stereotactic biopsy, made it on the table 5 minutes and couldn't take the pain in my back and hips. I have osteoporosis that doesn't help. I told them forget it. My Dr got me a surgeon, had the biopsy 10 days ago. Dcis. Lumpectomy yeterday. Both under general anesthesia. No pain, no bruising, barely need tylenol. I just prefer to be knocked out
Posts.Title: Wire localized biopsy vs. stereotactic biopsy? neujess neujess

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2017 03:12AM Oscarmom355 wrote: this is Oscarmom but now Oscarmom 355. wouldn't accept my email or password so created one under hubbys account. surgical went well yesterday, altho that wire insertion was no picnic. no pain to speak of, no nausea. tylenol is all I need. yesterday tho I was dizzy as hell when I got home, maybe the combo of no food, stress and anesthesia got me. results in a few days. so glad I didn't opt for the "steroetorture" table. planning on more rest today

Posts.Title: Latest on my re excision Oscarmom355 MTwoman

Posts.Content: Oscarmom355 wrote: FewHealth update. Met with surgeon to discuss the re excision surgery. He said he got out all of the dcis but wants slightly larger margins. He stressed slightly, 20 minute surgery, breast will not be smaller. Asked if we could do this after May vacation and he said normally sure but my vacation starts end of May. Since you healed so well we can do this tomorrow. So, tomorrow it is! Oh and when I said can I go to Tom Petty April 27 he said of course. You were fine 3 days after last week's surgery. If you change your mind I'll buy your tix. Funny dr. So surgery round 2 tomorrow. Round 1 was last Monday. Get it over with, bring on vacation Log in to post a reply
